body_html:
@drcege @jgong5 I agree that that would be nice, but I don't think we have the bandwidth for maintaining the docker images right now. We use them pretty heavily for our CI and testing PRs, so we like to be able to change them quickly to suit our testing needs without worry of breaking end-users.

However, we are actively trying to support easy binary installs. If ease of use is all that you need, then hopefully you can install Caffe2 easily with a variant of "conda install -yc caffe2 caffe2" (pip installs hopefully coming soon as well). You should also be able to put this into a dockerfile with something like

FROM continuumio:anaconda
#  some user setup
RUN conda install -yc caffe2 caffe2
# other docker commands
